intro: Oreodaphne neesiana, commonly known as the Malabar ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in dense forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
